Name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Dark Elves
Description:
Warhammer: Dark Elves is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Dwarfs
Description:
Warhammer: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Wood Elves
Description:
Warhammer: Wood Elves is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Wood Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.

Name: Tanks & Yanks: World War I 1917-1918 – Deluxe Edition
Description:
It is now 2017, one hundred years since the United States entered the First World War on the side of the Allies in one of the most unnecessary and wasteful wars ever fought.

The research required almost got in the way of the game system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after many rewrites it was decided to create one book as a game system and another as a simple note book. Both over lap each other. It did seem necessary to describe the tactical techniques in some great detail. Fortunately there is plenty of information on how these weapons were used on the battlefield. This availability of information made it possible to transform information into a realistic game system. However incomplete as it may be, the rules still effectively cover only a small part of the late ground war.

The game system includes supportive diagrams, illustrations, tactical notes and Quick Reference Sheets (Q.R.S.). The Turn Sequence and Turn Phases, once understood, make play easy and fast. The system has two Turn Sequences one of which is optional and the other mandatory. Six basic Turn Phases move the game along to a conclusion. Manufacturers will be glad by the fact that the game is best played using lots of figures and models. Let us be glad that there are sources for figures and models.

Basic units are 12 figures for a platoon with four platoons making a company and three to four companies making a battalion. Figures can be mounted individually or on multiple stands. Morale is based on unit size and applicable modifiers. Movement is with a D-10 die roll for both infantry and tanks. Transport and field artillery movement is determined by the roll of a D-6. There are two Turn Phases in which players can shoot. Hand-to-hand combat is easily performed. Players are always encouraged to adjust the rules to suit their perceptions.

To me, Yanks and Tanks captures the flavor of the late war. I hope your games will be hard fought, yet fun, and the game system competes well with other similar systems.

—description from designer

Name: KOKAGNE 357
Description:
KOKAGNE 357 is an abstract Domino style tile-laying game for 3 - 6 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get rid of all his Kominos.

Players begin the game with 5 Kominos. On his turn, each player places 1 Komino on the table and draws a new one at the end of his turn. Each Komino that is placed on the table (with the exception of the first one) must be orthogonally in contact with at least 3 symbols of previously played Kominos and at least 2 symbols must match. If a player completes an orthogonal or diagonal row with 3, 5, or 7 symbols of the same color/shape, he is allowed to give 1, 2 or 3 Kominos to his opponents.

-description from designer

Name: Bloedstollend Spel
Description:
A card game about haemophilia that allows the player to experience what it means to live with this inherited genetic disorder that impairs the body's ability to make blood clots, a process needed to stop bleeding.

This playing game can be played solo or with multiple players. Goal of the game is to score as many points as possible by doing all sorts of activities. More risky activities increase the risk of hemorrhages, which need to be avoided as much as possible.

—description from the designer

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ghost Soul Form Heroes
Description:
The Sword & Sorcery: Ghost Soul Form Heroes pack includes double-sided Background Talent cards allowing optional additional talents to heroes. It also includes a set of miniatures to replace the figures of the heroes while in ghost soul form.

Included as an add-on in the original Sword & Sorcery: Immortal Souls Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Teflarok: Game of the Gods – Abilities Expansion
Description:
In the game Teflarok: Game of the Gods, it does not make a difference which Norse god you choose to play as. But now, in this expansion, each of the nine gods have their own special abilities! This expansion adds new strategy and dynamics to the game. The expansion includes new rules, 9 ability cards for each of the gods, and a token for use with one of the gods.

Available as a a free print-and-play download or get it home-printed from the publisher when purchasing the base game, Teflarok: Game of the Gods.

-description from designer

Name: Schicksalspfade: Kartenset
Description:
The Schicksalspfade: Kartenset (Paths of Destiny Mapset) contains two double-sided game maps for the miniature game Schicksalspfade. The terrains are printed on high quality cardboard. They can be unfolded and put together in any way to reenact scenarios and campaigns from the Schickssalspfade base game.

In addition, the set also contains standees of characters from the base game, also printed on high-quality cardboard, as well as the reference sheet, the turn indicator and all the markers needed to replay the base game scenarios and campaigns. In addition, plastic feet are included in order to set up characters from a Schicksalspfade scenario against each other on the terrain maps.

—description from the publisher

Name: Color Addict Kidz
Description:
Players in turn put a card on top of the center stack. For a play to be allowed, the played card must display either the same color, or the same shape, than the top card of the stack.

If a player can't comply with this rule with any of his cards, he must draw a card. He may then play it immediately, if able, or pass.

The first player without any card in hand is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Adventure Post: 2018 Holiday Teaser
Description:
You are a hero, a person with great abilities, good temperament, a strong heart, and an even stronger love for spiked eggnog. As you sit in your favorite fur-covered, sheep wool-padded chair, alone in the solitude of greatness, you hear a series of thuds on your roof, followed by what sounds like scratching against the roof tiles. Your neighbor must have lost their gryphon again. You decide to round it back up and, hopefully, you will not need a finger reattachment from the cleric again...
You walk out of your cottage, it is winter but there’s no snow on the ground. Not yet. Climate change has seemed to shift the snow into the early months of the new year (and they say it’s a hoax?). Anyway, the towering buildings of the bustling city can be seen in the distance to your right, it is strange though… you are clearly part of a fantasy world, but the cityscape looks quite modern, like New York, Seattle, or Portland. There’s no time to dwell on the finer details though, you have a gryphon to catch!
When you look up on your roof, you do not see an eagle-lion at all. Rather, to your aghast, you see a very different creature! Above you, holding a bag full of wrapped parcels and decorated from wingtip to tail, is Kringle Klaws! You didn’t even believe in Kringle but here she is, right in front of you. A sack full of gifts and all. What a sight to see! Not only are you shocked that you are beholding Kringle Klaws but you are nearly floored when she starts to speak to you.
“Adventurer,” she says. “Something terrible has happened and I have been forced to seek your aid. I have known of your deeds since that very first piggly-wiggly you saved over in Yazoo and I need your skills. Only you can save our holiday.”
Knowing that you are too stunned to speak, she continues. “Another godly being has come from the land of the Vikings, the fiend calls himself ‘Kris.’ He has stolen my Red Globe of Illumination and I need you to get it back before the sun sets. Without the globe, I cannot deliver the gifts to your fellow humans.”
You have only the whit to ask “Where?”
“I watched him place the globe into a chest strapped to one of his reindeer,” she says. “I was able to follow the furry beast to a fort in the hills not far from here. There, the hooved menace passed by a large illuminated tree and disappeared down some stairs. We need to hurry, I am running out of time.”

—description from the designer

Name: S.O.S.petto
Description:
A game that combines pictionary, trivial pursuit and snakes&ladders

Players take turns drawing a card; the team gain points if one player can guess the drawing made by his teammate or by answering to the question offered by the card.
Winner is the team that reaches first 48 points.

—user summary

Name: Black Rose Wars: Inferno
Description:
The agonizing and acute screams echo through the halls, while other poor souls echo from everywhere. Welcome to the VIII circle, the one run by Malebranche. This circle is divided into several bolge, each one dedicated to a human sin.

In the Inferno expansion you will find a total of 18 miniatures and much more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Imperial Settlers: Fette Beute
Description:
This "promo expansion" box contains a bunch of promos which had not been published in German language before:

- Expeditionen (Expedition Tokens)
- Die Gilde der Wächter (The Watchers Guild)
- Bernsteinstraße und Flüchtlinge (Storage Tiles)
- Allgemeine Karten der Azteken (Aztecs - Common cards)
- Jagdrevier (Man vs Animals)
- Wirtshaus zum Pegasus (The Dice Tower Inn)
- Ruinen (Ruins)
- Marktplatz (Marketplace)
- Rüstungsschmied & Baracke (Armorer & Barracks)

Name: Galaxies Action
Description:
A pinball with a theme of space fight.

The winner is the player who can score the most points with the six white balls. The UFO's at the top of the board, give extra points if you hit them and get them off the ground!

Name: Maki Staki
Description:
A similar game to Rummy, in that players may pick from the discard pile or face down deck to create a set of five cards, always rounding down to five cards at the end of a turn. A number of "take that" action cards are worked into the deck, swapping player hands, discarding most valuable sets, etc.
—user summary

Maki Staki is a stylish sushi themed card game for three to six players. Simply collect sets of sushi cards to make your Maki but be ready to roll with the action cards. Will you fall foul of the Fatal Fugu or Wasabi Burn or will you pass the buck with the help of the Conveyor Belt?
—description from the publisher

Name: Human Punishment: Social Deduction 2.0 – Con V Tion promo card
Description:
Promo for Human Punishment

Card text:

"PERMANENT: As an Action, you may equip the laser or the rocket launcher."

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Unique High Priests
Description:
This freely downloadable PDF consists of eight Unique High Priest loyalty cards that can be substituted for the standard High Priest loyalty card. A normal High Priest miniature (or some sort of stand-in) is used to represent each Unique High Priest.

They are:

     Asenath Waite
     Crawford Tillinghast
     Ermengarde Stubbs
     Herbert West
     Joseph Curwen
     Keziah Mason
     Lavinia Whateley
     Pitpipo

Name: Speak Out: Misheard Song Lyrics
Description:
This expansion pack features phrases that sound a lot like song lyrics…but just ""off"" enough to challenge players and generate lots of laughs. Players draw from the deck and read the phrase as best as they can, but it's not so easy to do when the mouthpiece is hindering them from forming words correctly. Players try to say phrases such as ""Eye wood block drive tundra trials"". Teammates must correctly guess the phrase in under a minute in order to earn the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game wins. The expansion pack can be added to the original Speak Out game or 1 player can use the mouthpiece and everyone else can guess what they're saying.

Additional phrase cards for Speak Out. 72 cards (144 phrases) and 1 mouthpiece included.

Name: Elekt: Gremlin (Karta Promo)
Description:
4 additional cards for players who purchased the game in pre-order.

The card delivers new action: After increasing your Å»ar you can put 1 violence token OR 1 authority token on this card.

Name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Lost Kindred
Description:
Hidden for ages, unleashed at last

The lineage of the Kindred contains secrets within secrets. Lost and forgotten enemies returning for vengeance. Enslaved creations seeking liberation. A heritage known only through whispers and rumors. Each has its own destiny within the eternal struggle.

Black Chantry’s first expansion for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle is Lost Kindred, which focuses on five of the Kindred bloodlines: Blood Brothers, Gargoyles, Harbingers of Skulls, Salubri antitribu, and Samedi.

This set is a fixed assortment of 120 cards from a collection of 41 all-new cards, consisting of 23 crypt cards and 18 library cards.

Contents are detailed below. The number before each card is the  number of copies of that card in the bundle.

CRYPT CARDS:

BLOOD BROTHERS
2 Agi
2 Dorka
2 Gabi
2 Viri
2 Zizi

GARGOYLES
3 Chalcedony
3 Handsome Dan
2 Porphyry
2 Sheela Na Gig
2 Verbruch

HARBINGER OF SKULLS
3 Angelique
3 Erebus
3 Erlik
2 Hecate
3 Kurshid

SALUBRI ANTITRIBU
2 Castiel
2 Lailah
3 Michaela
3 Nuriel

SAMEDI
3 Jean Lisle
3 Mambo Jeanne
2 Marie-Pierre
2 Mr. Schwartz

Crypt cards subtotal: 56

LIBRARY CARDS:

4 Acheron Vortex
2 Achilles Heel
2 Alvusia
4 Blade of Bellona
4 Blessed Blade
2 Blessings of the Loa
4 Blood Buff
4 Camaraderie
4 Children of Stone
4 Disciple of Lazarus
4 Emerald Legionnaire
4 Inevitability of the Void
4 Necrosis
4 Relentless Reaper
2 Righteous Aura
4 Their Master’s Voice
4 Unleash the Hounds
4 Vengeful Spirit

Library cards subtotal: 64

Grand total: 120

—description from the publisher

Name: Run For Office Card Game
Description:
Politics can be dirty and politics can be frustrating but now politics can be fun with this fast-paced exciting card game. Players work to win the nomination of their party in the first phase of play then join together in teams to compete in the national election. Votes are gained by using political influence in this trick-taking game. Do you have what it takes to run for office and lead your country to greatness or, at least, have a lot of fun trying?

Run For Office is played in two phases of seven rounds each. The first phase is the Primary where each player works to win the nomination of their own party. The second phase is the Election where players work together in two competing teams to elect a president (winner).

In the Primary, each player gets a party, negotiates a platform by trading cards, and then gains Influence Cards. The Influence Cards are used to win Vote Cards by taking tricks. The Top two players who collect the most votes in their party are the winners of the Primary. The remaining players form teams with the two winners and a final Election takes place. Again, players gain Influence Cards to take Vote Cards through tricks but must do so in teams. The party members with the most votes at the end of the Election are the winners.

-description from designer

Name: Vindication: Leaders & Alliances
Description:
Grow in reputation, exert exciting new abilities, and forge powerful bonds in Leaders & Alliances, the first expansion for 2018's Vindication.

Use your attributes to gain rapport with the leaders of the lands six mysterious guilds and then use that rapport to perform powerful new abilities or build it up to initiate guild alliances for significant honor gains!

Contains alternative dice for more harrowing battles, a gargantuan mulberry scumbag, character art standees with wretched and vindicated designs, the introduction of guild monuments into the main board for a more robust area control experience, and more.

Name: The Great Alcatraz Escape
Description:
Play as either The Warden or as one of five playable Gang Leaders.

Gang Leaders must plot intricate escape plans and procure escape equipment from across the prison to help navigate one of their many loyal Inmates to Freedom before Turn 29, whilst simultaneously competing with backstabbing rival Gang Leaders, and a perverse Warden.

The game plays between 2-6 players. And is played on a 6pc 89cm x 56cm board.

An average Story Mode game lasts between 100-150 Mins.

The final board will contains an island prison contained within two separate Security Fences, the Inner Prison Walls, and exterior buildings (both marked out with grey outlined hexes).
The board is split into 6 segments/’Sectors’ upon which the prison Searchlight and Watchtowers exercise control over using specific ‘Warden Cards’.
There are eight potential Freedom Hexes (marked out with the stars and stripes) that an Inmate of a Gang must reach first (before another Gang Leader can) to Win.

The boardgame also includes three playable modes: Story Mode, Arcade Mode, and Team Mode.

—description from the publisher

Name: Katag: Le jeu de Carte
Description:
Katag: Le jeu de carte is a two players card games.
Each play have is own deck and try to defeat the four other players heroes by playing object cards and action cards.
On his turn, each player is playing one of his four heroes.
Then, according to each hero's action points and object points, a player can give objects and actions from his hand to his engaged Hero.
By comparing attack and defense, one of the hero defeats the other.
First player to defeat the four opposing heroes is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Yeti Eats Alien
Description:
Hilarious Headline Card Game! This game is a little different. You're dealt a hand of Headline Cards with words on them, each with a point value. When it's your turn, construct the headline that earns the highest points... and often the biggest laughs! The winner is the first player to get 500 points.

Grown-up fans of Man Bites Dog will love this adult twist!

Name: PRESIDENT-LY
Description:
The aim of the game is to be elected President by the majority. This means getting the necessary votes to win more than half of the seats in the National Congress.

In order to get the votes, everything is allowed. Deals with other political parties, buying judges, cheating... but you also need to take into account the other political parties and luck!

You can also choose your lifestyle and what proposals you are going to invest the money from your campaign into. Also you need to decide what you are going to do during your time as President to ensure you win the elections for the following year.

Each turn, players will roll the dice and move their token on the track - either clockwise or counter-clockwise. They then draw a card from a pile corresponding to the colour of the space they landed on. Each colour has its own actions associated with it: Green for political expertise, black for family life, purple for business, gold for bribe and deals.

During the game, several elections are held. During each elections, players invest money - which buys them votes. These translated in positions in congress, which will give back money. There are also special positions, which will give you different advantages. A player wins the game if he manages to get a majority during the elections (50%+1).

Players can negotiate alliances, which allows them to share the benefits of special positions - though it is not possible to win together.

Name: Endless Pass: A Viking Saga – Einar Boar Warrior Promo Card
Description:
Promo player board from the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Einar has the special ability "Shield Tactics: ignores health damage from greek fire cards".

Name: Das kunterbunte Igelrennen
Description: On the berries, get set, go! Who is the fastest hedgehog at the annual hedgehog race? In this original color cube running game, the colorful berries set the pace ... Since it may happen that one or the other berry is lost or stolen by another hedgehog. Squirrel and mouse are waiting for the festive Beerenschmaus at the finish. An exciting race for the berries! For children from 4 years.

Name: Bike Route Sacramento
Description:
Take a thrilling ride through Sacramentos most beautiful and iconic locations, while collaborating to connect them together and with the game.

- A great filler or gateway game that will hit the table often.
- The game can be taught in a few minutes and is highly thematic and accessible.
- Bike route is a light route building game that is semi-cooperative but includes optional rules for more complexity.
- The game has a great climax where eveybody fells like they are 'one turn away from winning.

In the game players build bike routes around the city winning community rewards. The first player to 7 points wins.

The game includes exquisite paintings of local landmarks and locations both past, present and future. This is not the Sacramento of today but a Sacramento of the imagination, with ideas that excite the spirit, from the historical past to the hopeful future. Bike Route includes everything from the majestic Alhambra movie palace to the soon to be completed Powerhouse Science Center on the river. All the wonderful things that you think about when you imagine Sacramento are included. Come play in the Sacramento that never was but will always exist in our hearts.

Bike Route has a long history and has been in development for over 10 years. Originally called Connections the game was never published and looked like it would end up on the pile of great ideas that never were. My daughter AR kept it alive by insisting that we play. "Papa lets play Connections" she would say and we would play. Despite the weak art the game was good and we kept enjoying the drama of the game. Eventually we decided that it should be brought back with new artwork and Bike Route was born. Connections was at heart a game about building connections between places and it seemed a perfect fit for a game about building bike routes. The idea took off and it has kept going ever since.

I was play-testing Bike Route at the main library with a local family and the boy across from me said "We live here..." and pointed at the map. "and I have been to the Zoo." he continued, indicating Land Park at the bottom of the board. Watching him I realized that a lot of kids know places in Sacramento but their mental map doesn't really connect them together. It was great to see the gears turning in his head as he saw all the places in town fit. He also knew DOCO and Old Town and quite a few other places. This was moment of affirmation; I realized that Bike Route could also bring back that great sense of place that is getting lost. Google guides us from place to place without any context or sense of relationship. Yes you can turn left and turn right but where are you?

I travel a lot for work and I am always happy to come home. Ususally I go to a town that is excited about what they are doing but in Sac we have it in spades. It seems that every week brings something new to our doorstep. Mabye a brand new artist or shome classy hippy selling tea. We have to recognize this exciting moment we are living in and celebrate it. Bike Route puts this fantasitc idea down on paper and freezes this instant so we can stop and savor what we have. Take a break from the hustle and bustle and enjoy a great game with family and friends. Recognize how lucky we are and enjoy it.

Bike route is for people who love bikes, games and Sacramento.

Name: Illuminati: Fake News Sites Promo Card
Description:
This is a give away card distributed at conventions or by buying from Warehouse 23 (SJ Games' online store).

This card adds the Fake News Sites group to the game. This media group gives the owner advantages to all attempts to neutralize other groups, along with providing them with some transferable power.

Name: Madorino Karuta VR
Description:
This floor plan-themed party game is in the style of the classic "telephone game."

18 floor plan cards are spread across a table. Using the game's special app, players can explore the rooms of a house.

One player looks around inside the rooms, and uses words and gestures to describe what they look like.
The other players try to find the corresponding floor plan card from among the cards on the table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Overlap
Description:
Overlap is a card game using small, square cards, each with nine squares that are each colored red, yellow, or blue. The goal of the game is to score points by placing cards such that squares of the same color align. As the name suggests, the cards can overlap one another, adding another level of strategy and requiring spatial-reasoning and critical thinking skills.

How to play:

Set up: Shuffle the deck of cards, then deal each player five cards. Each player places this stack of cards face down in front of them. Place one card from the deck face up in the center of the playing surface.

Gameplay:  Choose a starting player. That player draws the top card from his/her stack and plays it on the playing surface following card placement rules, and then calculates and records his/her score for the turn. Play then continues clockwise. When all players have placed all their cards, the round ends and the cards are shuffled back into the deck. The number of rounds corresponds with the number of players, with each player having an opportunity to go first.

Card placement: Cards may be placed adjacent to other cards in play, but they must be played so that at least one square aligns with a square on an adjacent card. Additionally, they may be played so that the cards partially overlap, as long as the squares align. When cards are played, at least one square must lie over an empty space (you cannot occlude 9 squares with any given card.)

Scoring: When you place a card, any instance in which a square of a certain color lies next to a square of that same color on another card is worth one point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer

Name: Adventure Post: A Path of Self-Learning
Description:
Adventure Post is a series of solo-mini-adventures delivered to your door on a postcard each week. Every week is a small portion of an overall larger campaign which will take many, many weeks to come to conclusion. The postcard will include a QR code or website address that will direct you to the weekly adventure document. The document will explain the setup, instructions, and key areas on the adventure map.

A Path of Self-Learning uses simplistic character creation and dice rolls for combat and interacting with the world. There are a series of questions, all of which alter the final conflict of the game in various ways. On the 12th week, the adventure will be completed and to survive is to win.

The Story:
As punishment for a crime committed against humanity, the Lord of the land has sentenced you to a Trial of Character. You must be judged against both physical and mental challenges in which you will discover who you truly are. You will learn about the three principles, Truth, Love, and Courage. You will face moral dilemmas in each of the eight virtues where your answers must be considered carefully. Finally, you will face a mighty foe in one-on-one combat. A foe whose power is a reflection of the choices you have made. Can you prove yourself worthy to earn your mantle back, Avatar?

A Path of Self-Learning is only the first adventure in a larger overall campaign. There are more aventures of different themes and new rules on the horizon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo
Description:
Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo is a two-player game of "Yasuda Auditorium Incident", a conflict between Tokyo Metropolitan Police's riot squad and All Campus Joint Struggle League, January 18-19, 1969 during University of Tokyo Protests.

FYI
https://features.japantimes.co.jp/student-riots/

The game system is based on Avalon Hill's Storm over Arnhem.
Riot Police player aims to remove university students from Yasuda Auditorium (and the surrounding buildings). University Students player aims to block it.

A sequel: University of Tokyo Too Far

Name: Corregidor: the Rock
Description:
Corregidor: the Rock includes the following:


     21 Scenarios covering actions from 1942 (3 scenarios) and 1945 (18 scenarios)
     2 Campaign Games
     180 full color, die cut 1/2" counters (Infantry, SW, Control, and info)
     64 full color, die cut 5/8" counters (2 AFVs, 3 Aircraft, and info)
     HASL map printed on two 22"x28" sheets that cover a portion of the 'head' of the island based on the state of the island in 1945, and is used for the CGs and 33% of the scenarios (the rest being on geo boards from other parts of the island)
     Player aids for the Campaign Games, NOBA, and Para Drops
     Rules pages describing Vehicles/Ordnance notes, Historical Battle Rules (HBR), map terrain and campaign game rules


Ownership of the following Hasbro/MMP ASL products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor, Yanks, Gung Ho, and Code of Bushido (or Rising Sun)

Ownership of the following Advanced Squad Leader components are required to play all 21 of the included scenarios:
Nationalities - Americans, Partisans & Japanese
Boards - 2, 24, 36, 37, 39, 40, 43, 44, 46, 58, & 61

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Daemons of Chaos Official Update
Description:
Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos Official Update is an expansion to the 7th Edition Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos army book from 2008, released in August 2012, during the 8th Edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 14-page softcover booklet provides 8 pages of rules for Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos, with the other 6 pages (printed upside down) dedicated to a similar expansion of 4th Edition Warhammer: 40,000 Chaos Daemons codex from 2008.

The purpose of this booklet is to provide rules for new models, which were released since the army book appeared. This booklet was provided with White Dwarf 392.

—user summary

Name: Littlestorm Activity: Body & Letters
Description:
A really nice and fun alphabet game. Let children learn the alphabet while they play a suerfun game.

Littlestorm Activity is a creative and learning-rich children's game which is filled with entertaining action.

The game can either be played as a team game or individually.

Name: Singolo
Description: Singolo is a chess variant where the player moves like the horse. All 64 fields of the board needs to be touched exactely once.

Name: Gain Less
Description:
The more you win, the more you lose!

The object of the game is to demonstrate the pitfalls of gambling. This is an educational game for young people (ages 6-19). It teaches them that although gambling sometimes brings in big money for them, most of the time it ends up with heavy loses, resulting in accumulated debts and addictive behavior.
—description from the rulebook

Gain Less is a roll-and-move game, with a number of "betting" spaces for players to spend money at. There is always a chance of winning more money back than you have spent, but the game is designed so that you lose money more often than win, similar to the odds found at casinos and other gambling houses. Gain Less is an educational game, used to demonstrate to young teenagers and adults that when you gamble, ultimately you lose more money than you win.
—user summary

Name: Suspekt
Description: The players try to move their pieces to the center of the game board. But be careful: The other players should not find out which piece is yours! Therefore, bluffing is an essential part of the game.

Name: Euro-Mille
Description:
The easiest way to the Euro!
A family board game that can be played from 2-6 persons. Although Euro-Mille is directly linked to the Euro conversion, it can still be played as a nostalgic game to remember the good old times with different currencies in all countries across Europe.

Name: S.F.X.: The Sound Effects Game
Description:
The game includes a CD with 33 recorded sounds, such as a church bell, a glass breaking, a car crash, a duck, etc.

Every player gets 5 cards and as soon as the sound from one of his card is played, he must put it down as fast as possible.

Name: Süßer Tod
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Sweet Death

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Fatal Truffles! 
Armande de Coca is dead - next to him the best sweets from all over the world...

Name: Schnurrende Zeugen
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Purring whitnesses

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

The only whitnesses for the murder of Millicent Manners are her cats.

Name: Mord im Atelier
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Murder in the atelier

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Albert Thomas, a well-known artist and art faker is dead. Who killed him?

Name: Tödliche Diät
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal Diet

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Claudia Culpepper is killed in an exclusive spa while she wanted to go for a midnight meal...

Name: Tödlicher Kaufrausch
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal spending spree

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

A mysterious crime in a shopping mall where 2 men wear the same shirts and one of them is dead now...

Name: Die Ratten von Nizza
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Rates of Nice

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

This game deals with one of the biggest bank robberies ever.

Name: Warren Wars: Living on Burrowed Time
Description:
Warren Wars is a game about racing to be the first to build your army while your opponents are trying to steal your Carrots and bunnies.

Each player takes turns first drawing a card and then playing a card. Everyone is aiming to be the winner by being the first to fill their Warren with five Recruits or by being the last player standing after wiping out everyone else.

There will be card stealing, taking over other players’ turns, all while trying to maintain their own Warrens.

—description from the publisher

Name: Psychobunnies
Description:
Psychobunnies – What’s that then?

It’s an incredibly addictive tabletop card game that challenges your memory & strategy skills whilst still having an element of luck that can come around to bite you on the backside when you least expect it. Oh, and it’s got psychotic bunnies. Don’t forget the bunnies.

To win the game, you need to ensure you have the lowest score possible each round. The last bunny standing is the winner. That might sound easy, but with only 10 seconds to view half or your drawn cards and the other half of your hand a complete mystery, it soon becomes more of a challenge!

Play can become incredibly strategic (e.g. do you 'play safe' and try to attain low scoring cards, or do you collect high scoring cards that others are more likely to discard, running the risk of being stuck with them when play ends?).

Then there's the element of luck. You have no idea what half of your deck contains. Sometimes at the end of a round, they're as much as a surprise to you as to the rest of the players. This can be a good or a bad thing! Add to that several 'Trick or Treat' cards designed to test your skills (and your sanity), and Psychobunnies is an absolute riot to play.

No bunnies were harmed in the making of this game.

—description from the designer

Name: Detective Mickey
Description: This is an exciting memory game with Mickey and his friends for 2-6 young players.

Name: Cinderella's Ball
Description: An exciting dice game for 2-4 young players.

Name: Party Pictures
Description:
The judge draws a Party Pictures Card from the deck and shows everyone. Players select the best matching Caption Card from their hands and place it face down. The judge reads the Caption Cards aloud and selects the funniest caption. The player with the funniest match wins the card! The first player to earn five Party Pictures wins.

Contents:
75 Picture Cards (150 photos)
300 Caption Cards
Instructions

Name: Thomas die kleine Lokomotive und seine Freunde: Würfelpuzzle
Description: This game is a combination of puzzling and rolling a dice. The player who manages to finish his puzzle at first wins.

Name: World Wide Wob: Das Spiel um die Zukunft einer Stadt
Description:
The players may play different roles to further develop Wolfsburg, a German town. 
They are experts in different domains, such as city development, real estate speculation, city council, VW group. The winner is the player who developed Wolfsburg the best.

Name: Dragon and the Hermit Kingdom: The Second Korean War
Description:
Modern War #45, November 2019.

The Dragon and The Hermit Kingdom is a two player game that covers the hypothetical simulation of a second Korean War that could occur in the very near future. This game is a precursor to The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun (Modern War #42). It simulates the war that would have occurred on the Korean peninsula just prior to that game’s setting. The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun assumes that a Chinese victory had already occurred in Korea. This game, however, simulates the entirety of that preceding conflict, beginning with a supposed North Korean invasion of South Korea.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters.

Name: Block by Block: The Battle of Huế, 1968
Description:
Block by Block is a two-player conflict simulation of the 1968 Battle of Huáº¿. Players must balance the military difficulties imposed by the challenges of constrained urban warfare and unique terrain of the Huáº¿ Citadel, with the overriding considerations of each side’s respective political goals. The North Vietnamese player must hold the city for as long as possible, to create a media event and lay the groundwork for a new revolutionary government. The South Vietnamese and American player must retake Huáº¿ before this process can advance too far, but not also jeopardize their own political sensitivities from casualties and heavy-handedness.

The map covers an area of 13 square kilometers (approximately 5 square miles). Each turn represents four to five days. Units represent platoon/detachment to battalion sized units.

—description from the publisher


Published with Modern War #48.

Name: Rush to Flush
Description:
Card game where players are trying to complete a Royal Flush (A, K, Q, J, 10 all in same suit.

Players are dealt seven cards.  On each turn players first draw from the to of the draw pile or discard pile. Then player discards one card to the discard pile.  If card is an action card then you follow instructions of the card.  As soon as player acquires a Royal Flush (regardless if it is their turn) they take a chip for the suit in which they have a Royal Flush.  Play continues until all chips have been claimed.  Winner is the one with the most chips.

—user summary

Name: Apocalyptic Picnic
Description:
With a light-hearted campy theme and action-packed gameplay, Apocalyptic Picnic takes the family reunion to a whole new level. The "potato salad" is tainted and everyone is turning into zombies. Be the last player to survive this picnic gone wrong and win the game! This is a card management game in which the key is in the cards and how and when they are used. By carefully managing their cards, a player must aim to wipe out all opponents and become the sole survivor!

Each player starts with a family consisting of five members (four healthy members and one zombie) and a hand of cards. On each turn, a player draws and plays cards. Offensive moves include using *BITE* cards to bite your opponents' family members and turn them into zombies. Players are limited in the number of bites they may play based on the number of zombies they have — which means you need to keep a few of these ghoulish guys around.

Go on the defensive by playing *FOOD* or *EQUIPMENT* cards that protect players from bites. Watch out for the *PLAY NOW* cards as they impact all players and their cards in someway.

The always healing "GrandMa's Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup" instantly turns one of that player's zombies back into a healthy family member. (Thanks Grandma!) The most lethal and powerful card of all — "Suspicious Seconds", a second heaping helping of that tainted potato salad — instantly turns a player into a zombie with an unblockable biting capacity. The last player with healthy members wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pizza Ninja
Description:
Pizza Ninja is the fastest and most honorable way to order pizzas. We guarantee 30 minutes delivery time or our delivery ninja will commit seppuku to regain honor. Order now (Not serving pirates)!

Pizza Ninja is a solitaire game, were you will deliver pizzas to hungry workers in a business building. But beware the pirates that want those pizzas too.

During each of your turns, you can take four actions to move the Ninja around the board and deliver one of your pizzas on random spots on the board. Or you can fight nearby pirates with your Ninja skills. But after you have done your actions, all the pirates will move closer to you and the pizzas and even more pirates will enter the office. If they reach you and hit you, you will loose some of your precious time.

You win, if you can deliver all your pizzas to spots on the board before the time runs out.

Name: Circadians: First Light – Allies Expansion
Description:
The Allies Expansion for Circadians: First Light introduces 4 more characters with their own unique abilities. These allies are non-human citizens living aboard Moontide.

The new characters and their abilities are:

UL KAH TAL
You begin the game with your unique upgrade tile installed in your second garage.

SUNARI
You begin the game with your unique farm tile installed in your research base.

BJORG AND SAL
You may use Sal as a 3-valued die at any location, except the Depository and Negotiation Board.

ZAPPORAH
You may immediately roll and assign any dice gained during the execute phase to your farms.

Name: Horse & Musket IV: Tides of Revolution
Description:
After the Seven Years’ War, the forces of revolt and revolution gathered strength. First there were protests in the 13 American colonies as well as a minor rebellion in Louisiana, and a short but sharp guerilla war in Corsica. The great powers though continued on, making a few concessions but assuming their power was unbroken. Then came Lexington, where British regulars and American militia traded shots. In the end, the British lost the American colonies, but avoided losing territory to France and Spain. France, having bankrupted itself aiding the Americans, underwent a revolution that is often considered the dawn of the modern age.

The French Revolution was complicated, confusing, violent, and inspiring. It was an age of wonders and nightmares. It also would have ended if not for the French army. The combination of post-Seven Year’s War reforms and the transformation of the army from an instrument of the Bourbons into a citizen’s army made it a formidable force. Warfare in this age blended old and new tactics. Linear formations in the style of Frederick II continued, but with a greater use of skirmishers and light troops. The French mastered this new style of warfare and won a series of sweeping victories that undermined the old powers and ushered in the bloodiest and most fevered war of the era.

Battles included are...

Borgo - October 8, 1768 – “Europe is watching you.”

Kagul - August 1, 1770 – The Glory of Catherine

Bunker Hill - June 17, 1775 – “Another such would have ruined us.”

Long Island - August 27, 1776 – “If you refuse I shall shoot you through the head.”

Princeton - January 3, 1777 – “It’s a fine fox chase my boys!”

Germantown - October 4, 1777 – “Form! Form! It is only a scouting party!”

Bemis Heights - October 7, 1777 – The Decisive Battle of the American Revolution

Newtown    - August 29, 1779 – The Sullivan Expedition

Camden - August 16, 1780 – “…the death of a soldier fighting for the rights of man.”

Guilford - March 15, 1781 – “We fight, get beat, rise, and fight again.”

Pensacola - May 8, 1781 – Yo Solo

Eutaw Springs - September 8, 1781 – “…the most obstinate fight I ever saw.”

ZieleÅ„ce - June 18, 1792 – Virtuti Militari

Jemappes - November 6, 1792 – The French Republic’s First Triumph

Neerwinden - March 18, 1793 – Death Knell of the Bourbon Army

Hondschoote - September 6-8, 1793 – “Failing cartridges, are there not bayonets?”

Fleurus - June 6, 1794 – The End of the Terror

Castiglione - August 5, 1796 – Denouement of the Five Days Campaign

Würzburg - September 3, 1796 – Archduke Charles Ascendant

Caldiero - November 12, 1796 – “What shall become of these brave men?”

Arcole - November 15-17, 1796 – The Birth of the Napoleonic Legend

—description of the publisher

Name: Horse & Musket V: Age of Napoléon
Description:
The final phase of the French Revolutionary War saw the rise of the greatest commander of the era. Napoléon Bonaparte was a military and political genius, who used his growing popularity to make himself ruler of France. After an assassination attempt, he made himself emperor, hoping to be accepted by other monarchs. He was not, and the mutual distrust and antipathy led both sides to choose war over peace. The conflict spanned all of Europe, from the mountains of Portugal to the gates of Moscow. The struggle spilled into the wider world, in time dragging America into the conflict as she waged a separate and futile war with the British.

Constant warfare and decades of military theory led to a major shift in warfare. The pace of operations, and the depredations of war, increased to a frenzy not seen in Europe since the Roman Empire. Battles were big, decisive, and bloody. Infantry became more mobile and proficient, with mixed formations and tactics being used. The French in particular pioneered a combined arms approach to warfare where infantry, cavalry, and artillery were used in concert. Even after the wars ended the desire for fast decisive action would dictate western military policy until World War II.

The battles included are...

Rivoli - January 14, 1797 – Bonaparte's First Masterpiece

The Pyramids - July 21, 1798 – “Forty centuries look down upon you.”

Novi - August 15, 1799 – “Now it’s time for action!”

Hohenlinden - December 3, 1800 – The Zenith of Jean Moreau

Austerlitz - December 2, 1805 – “We are babies in the hands of a giant.”

Cape Town - January 8, 1806 – “The bitter cup must be drunk to the bottom.”

Auerstadt - October 14, 1806 – “Tell your Marshal he is seeing double.”

Friedland - June 14, 1807 – “Then we have already made peace.”

Bailén - July 19, 1808 – “The whole nation is exasperated and determined to fight.”

Wagram - July 5-6, 1809 – Archduke Charles’ Last Battle

Bussaco - September 27, 1810 – “I have never witnessed a more gallant charge.”

Albuera - May 16, 1811 – “Die hard 57th, die hard!”

Queenston Heights - October 13, 1812 – Disaster at Niagara

Maloyaroslavets - October 24, 1812 – “Here began the flight and destruction of the enemy.”

Dresden - August 26-27, 1813 – “God has uttered His judgement. He was of your opnion.”

The Thames - October 5, 1813 – “Remember the Raisin!”

La Rothière - February 1, 1814 – “What will they say in Paris after this victory?”

Lundy’s Lane - July 25, 1814 – Butchery at Dusk

New Orleans - January 8, 1815 – The Eighth

La Souffel - June 28, 1815 – “Let the brave swear never to quit their eagles.”

—description of the publisher

Name: Horse & Musket VI: Sunset of an Era
Description:
With the final defeat of Napoléon Bonaparte, a new conservative era of anti-liberal and anti-republican politics began in Europe. It was a false dawn for the forces of reaction. In the Americas, Spain’s empire evaporated in a series of rebellions. The defeat of the republicans led to a renewal in great power struggles, such as the Crimean War, and nationalist and expansionist wars. The middle of the century saw the unification of Italy and Germany through warfare. America, wracked by division over slavery, politics, and economics, was ripped apart by a civil war that ended in the reunification of the nation.

The great changes in government and ideology were matched by a shift towards industrialized war. By the 1850s railroads, telegraphs, and photographs were changing the face of battle. The smoothbore flintlock was replaced by the rifled musket, which was in turn replaced with repeating rifles. The era of linear combat, the basic tactics of western warfare for thousands of years, now gave way to a looser form of warfare, where technology was as important as training and generals. It was the end of an era.

The battles included are...

Ayacucho - December 9, 1824 – “If from Romulus, Rome; from Bolívar, it is Bolivia.”

The Alamo - March 6, 1836 – “What are the lives of soldiers, than so many chickens?”

Mudki - December 18, 1845 – Opening Battle of the First Anglo-Sikh War

Buena Vista - February 23, 1847 – “Tell him to give ‘em hell!”

Cerro Gordo - April 17-18, 1847 – “Mexico no longer has an army.”

Novara - March 22, 1849 – The Abdication of Charles Albert I

Balaclava - October 25, 1854 – “There, my lord, is your enemy! There are your guns!”

Inkerman - November 5, 1854 – “I tell you, we gave ‘em a hell of a towelling.”

Second Sevastopol - September 8, 1855 – “I’m here, and I shall stay here.”

Solferino - June 24, 1859 – The Birth of the Red Cross

Volturno - October 1, 1860 – “Victory all along the Line!”

First Bull Run - July 21, 1861 – “There is Jackson standing like a stone wall.”

Second Bull Run - August 28-30, 1862 – The Confederacy at Flood Tide

Antietam - September 17, 1862  – The Bloodiest Day of the American Civil War

Irish Bend - April 14, 1863 – “Grover had stopped just short of the prize.”

Rangiriri - November 20, 1863 – Death Knell of the KÄ«ngitanga Movement

Lookout Mountain - November 24, 1863 – “It is all poetry.”

Missionary Ridge - November 25, 1863 – “When those fellows get started all hell can’t stop them.”

First Petersburg - June 15-18, 1864 – “You cannot strike a full blow with a wounded hand.”

Peach Tree Creek - July 20, 1864 – Hood Takes Command

Cedar Creek - October 19, 1864 – “God DAMN you, don’t cheer me!”

Selma - April 2, 1865 – “Go in boys, give them hell, we have the city...”

First Tuyutí - May 24, 1866 – The South American Waterloo

Königgrätz - July 3, 1866 – Königgrätzer Marsch

—description of the publisher
Families: History: Latin American Wars of Independence

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – The Dreaded Ambull
Description:
That’s right – the Ambull is back, and it’s angrier than ever! This model brings a classic from Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader to life in stunning detail, finally giving this terrifying beast a miniature worthy of its reputation.

The Dreaded Ambull is the first in a series of expansions for Blackstone Fortress, allowing you to add this xenos monster to your games, whether you’re hunting for its lair or simply adding it to the possible Hostiles that can turn up in any given encounter. More than just a new adversary, this is a fully-fledged side-quest to add to your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: 9 Lives
Description:
9 Lives is a card game where you'll be playing as a cat and the goal is to be the last cat standing. The game features quirky scenarios and funny artworks of cats doing crazy cat stuff. Its a game ideally played by friends and family during gatherings.

The game can be played by 2 to 5 players and can go from 15-30 minutes. You will be playing as a cat with 9 Lives and the goal is to eliminate other players before you own nine lives runs out. There are two decks in the game: the Paw cards, which allows you to play tricks and actions to give you the advantage; and Karma cards, which simulates the scenarios that happen on a player's turn. The game features an exciting balance of strategy and randomness which leaves keeping guessing how to play smarter on your next game.

—description from the designer

Name: 30s
Description:
A simple dice game that requires 6 dice and a way to keep score. The goal is to score as few points as possible, while also attempting to knock the player to your left out of the game.

The player takes the 6 dice and rolls them with the objective of getting a total of 30 or more showing on the dice. After each roll the player must set aside one or more dice. The player's turn continues until all 6 dice have been set aside, and then the face value is added up to determine the total for that player.

If a total value of 30 is achieved, the player scores 0 points. If the total is LESS than 30, the player scores the difference in points (a roll of 26 would score the player 4 points). If the total is MORE than 30, the player takes all 6 dice and rolls again. Every die that shows their total - 30 is set aside and they continue rolling until they do not roll any more of that number or all 6 dice have been set aside. The player to the left then gains points equal to the total shown on the set aside dice.

Example: Player A's original roll totals 32. Player A rolls all 6 dice and gets one 2. That die is set aside and the remaining 5 dice are rolled. This time there are two more 2s. Those two dice are set aside and the remaining 3 dice are rolled. No more 2s are rolled so Player A stops. The player to Player A's left gains 6 points for the three 2s that were rolled.

The dice are then passed to the left and play continues.

Once a player scores 30 or more points, that player is eliminated from the game. The game ends when only one player remains and that player is the winner.

For a shorter game without player elimination, the game can be played until the first player scores above 30. When that happens, the player with the fewest points is the winner.

—user summary

Name: DICTADORES
Description:
DICTADORES is a card game for parties in which you must avoid being punished while getting drunk.
The dictator sets the laws of the game, if someone does not comply, he will be punished.
There are cards that force you to drink and others in which you must play to avoid it.
Each player will have his turn as a dictator, with all the privileges that means.
But beware of coups d'etat.
Do you dare to play it?

The game is played in three decks, the dictator will play with the punishment deck and the law deck, while the rest with the town deck.

A player starts assuming the role of DICTATOR and takes two punishments that he keeps in secret and a law that he puts on his back.

When the first player takes a card from the village deck he must comply with the instructions and this letter, and if it is his turn to drink, he must also comply with the laws.

If the player does not comply with a law, the dictator gives him a punishment.

When the dictator runs out of punishments, it is the turn of another.

In the town deck there are 4 coups. The first three allow the player to end the dictator's turn by removing his punishments. The fourth coup d'etat wins the game, and you can choose any punishment from the deck to give to the current dictator.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game Vol. 2: Saikyou Kuso Shinka!
Description:
This is a game for 2 to 5 people that is a harsh parody of trading card games. The cards are intentionally overpowered and poorly balanced. It's based off of the comic Pop Team Epic.

—user summary

AmiAmi's sweepingly successful "Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game" is back with version 2!
This authentic trading card game-ish card game is upgraded to be even more Crapperific!
The highly rated Crap elements from the first version are strengthened in addition two new ones added like "hieroglyphic text" and "effects on other separate games" to reach a new level of Crappy.
This can be mixed with the 1st version and played to be even more special.
That's not all! It has lots of content from the "Pop Team Epic" anime starting with "Aoi Shouta" from the last episode to the "Takeshobo Building" which fans loved.
Some card game's illustrator drew 4 new fake illustrations that are collected here. Enjoy the beautiful illustrations of Popuko and Pipimi that are Magical Girl-ified and Monster-ified!

[We Refuse]

    This is a trading card game-ish variety card game. 90% of the content is crap, thank you for your kind understanding.
    No matter how crappy this card game is it can at the very least be used for regular card games.
    No matter what may happen during a battle the designer and seller take no responsibility. Please understand it is your own or another player's fault.


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Helmut Wulf – Star Player
Description:
Helmut Wulf, a hitherto unremarkable Lineman for the Bruendar Grimjacks, once volunteered to try out a risky new piece of equipment at his coach’s request. He picked up a chainsaw for the first time and a lifelong bond was forged. It is quite likely that since that day he’s never gone more than five minutes without at least one chainsaw in his hands – certainly, he’s never been seen in public without one.

In 2483 it is the height of the chainsaw craze and Helmut Wulf has risen to prominence as a master of his craft. In a memorable match against the now-disbanded Bogstaff Beardlings, he broke a strong cage formation single-handedly by leaping into the middle and spinning around wildly. How he survived (especially considering how very slippery it suddenly gets) is a mystery, but there’s no doubt that the man’s got style.

Helmut Wulf is a Star Player who can be included in the following teams: Amazon, Chaos Renegades, Human, Lizardmen, Norse, Vampire. His unique brand of carnage and mayhem means that your opponent will be running scared from the first kickoff, and the revving of his chainsaw will haunt their nightmares for nights to come.

This is a complete, multipart resin kit which contains one Helmut Wulf. He is supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl base, and his rules can be found in the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Karla von Kill – Star Player
Description:
Karla von Kill takes a day off from the family pig farm to watch some Blood Bowl at a local stadium with some friends. Having never seen the sport up-close before (only having caught the occasional big match on the crystal ball in the local tavern), she is immediately taken with the flashy plays, colourful commentary and over-the-top violence. She sticks around after the match to help clear up and manages to speak to some of the Hochstadt Hellfires, who convince her to abandon the provincial life and join them on the road. She spends the next few weeks driving carts, raising stands, selling tickets and dealing with troublemakers, but it isn’t long before the Hellfires open their doors for new recruits. Karla is one of the first in line, where her passion for the sport impresses head coach KruÌˆber. She takes a spot on the reserves bench and never looks back.

In 2483 Karla helped the Hellfires quit the backwater circuit and start hitting some of the bigger stadiums. She has proven herself a natural Blitzer, always leading the team from the front. When they came up against the Bloodskull Brutes, she coordinated the front offence to bring down both of the team’s Trolls in short order, and was awarded the position of team captain in recognition of her efforts.

Karla von Kill is a Star Player who can be included in the following teams: Amazon, Halfling, Human, Norse. This highly detailed miniature makes a fantastic addition to any team that can afford to hire her.

This is a complete, multipart resin kit which contains one Karla von Kill. She comes with a 32mm Blood Bowl base and her rules can be found in the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Goblin Killer Kontraptions
Description:
From the publisher:

There is a long, messy history of Blood Bowl teams sneaking weapons onto the pitch, but few do it with such regularity (not to mention unapologetic brazenness) as Goblins. With very few exceptions, Goblin teams tend to have ready access to a well-stocked arsenal of unusual equipment at their disposal, most of which is hilariously deadly.

Goblin teams don't play fair, and nor should you! Rally crowd support with an ’Ooligan, and threaten your opponent’s End Zone with the super-quick and agile Pogoer and Doomdiver.

Goblin Killer Kontraptions is a 16-piece set cast in high-quality resin, and makes the following three Goblin Blood Bowl miniatures:

- 1 ’Ooligan
- 1 Pogoer
- 1 Doomdiver

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Nurgle Rotspawn
Description:
From the publisher:

Nurgle is ever-generous with his gifts, bestowing them upon his followers with reckless abandon. If a player receives too many gifts, or is granted them too quickly, their body may be warped too far and their mind affected, causing their form to constantly twist and writhe with new mutations and leaving their sanity shattered. Rotspawn of Nurgle are such cursed champions. They can no longer understand a game plan and need careful handling, but they are kept around for the strength they bring and the disruption they cause.

The Nurgle Rotspawn is not just a brawler, but a lynchpin of the line of scrimmage. Its combination of Tentacles and Disturbing Presence can lock down the centre of the pitch by disrupting your opponent's actions, and Foul Appearance can confound their attempts to take it on directly. And it hits like… well, a bloated mass of muscle and tentacles!

The Nurgle Rotspawn is a high-quality resin kit comprising four parts and supplied with a 40mm round plastic base.

Key Features
-A key member of Nurgle's Rotters team
-Able to dominate the line of scrimmage with high Strength and powerful skills

Name: Magalhães Bastos
Description:
In Magalhães Bastos, the players will have to save the women who will appear in the neighborhood, solving their problems to win their hearts. Sagacity is necessary to move around the district, since the other players are a constant threat.

On his turn, a player performs three different actions from a menu of twelve. Most actions involve gaining, buying, selling or discarding various items and cards, often on specific board spaces. They also include moving the player's character, threatening (and possibly attacking) an opponent, earning money, hiring a security guard and winning a woman's heart - or stealing it from another player. The game ends after ten rounds or when any player's score goes past 32 points.

—user summary

Name: Catacombs Conquest: Qurru promo card
Description:
Promo card for Catacombs Conquest.

Sword Team

Protector - Climb: Place your Character Disc on top of any Obstacle Disc. Must be knocked off to be damaged.

Name: Catacombs Conquest: Angga promo card
Description:
Promo card for Catacombs Conquest.

Skull Team

Arachnid - Climb: Place your Character Disc on top of any Obstacle Disc. Must be knocked off to be damaged.

Name: Alley Oops!
Description:
"Alley Oops! - A Raucous Game of Stumbling and Tumbling for Klutzes!”

Play the raucous game of stumbling and tumbling, Alley Oops! In this traditional American game you roll your colored magic tumbling bean on the ramped game board into a scoring hole. It’s fun and harder than it looks. Classic and addictive fun for the whole family in the original 1930’s retro box. A unique gift for any classic game collector.

The name Alley Oops comes from French Gymnasts, who yell “Allez Hop!” (Let’s Go!) before tumbling on the gym mat.

—description from the publisher

This is a replica of a vintage board game from the 1930s.

Name: Knightzz
Description:
Knightzz is a thrilling game derived from Chess Knight.

The game portraits knights quest for ancient relics. Knight's Movement in the board is same as that in chess game (L shaped moves) and no movement is allowed to previously occupied cells. One knight can conquer another knight in his path. The knight who collects 5 relics first will win the game.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: iGure Table Soccer
Description: A flicking table soccer game.

Name: True Crime Legends
Description:
True Crime Legends is a gangster themed card game for 3-5 players. It takes around an hour to play. Players will lead a syndicate competing to control the lucrative and dangerous markets of the underworld. Invest in assets, smuggle, bribe, murder, steal and hire legendary gangsters from a deck of the most iconic criminals of the past century, each with unique stats and abilities. Ruthlessly rise above your rivals to be crowned the boss of bosses.

(website)

Players start with one boss card, but there is a public marketplace that allows players to fill out a tableau (their syndicate) by draft-purchasing up to 3 extra *historical* gangsters, 4 assets (usually venues associated with crime) and 4 upgrades (eg drug boats, evidence, guns, armor).

The tableau allows each gangster to be lined up with an Asset and an Upgrade which increase the gangster's abilities.
The players will take it in turn to activate each gangster, with various abilities including earning money, stealing money, attacking other gangsters, stealing other gangsters, destroying Assets/Upgrades and attempting a narcotics shipment. The success of these actions depends on a dice roll, but increasing the gangsters' abilities increases their chance of success. If they do not succeed, a gangster they have targeted will usually have an ability that allows retaliation.

Some of the Assets (locations) give income at the end of each round, if they still have a gangster assigned to them.
At the end of four rounds, the player with the most money is the winner.

(NB this is based on the 2018 version of the game)

Name: Four Corner Kingdoms
Description:
Four Corner Kingdoms involves building a tableau of your kingdom using unique placement mechanisms to create combinations of icon types, suite types, etc. which score at the end of the game. Additional aspects of the cards can interfere with your opponents.

Players play two cards from their hands, one at a time. They place the cards in their playing area (tableau) which also represents a map of the topography of their land. There are rules about what terrain does when it is placed (e.g. draw an additional card, gain immunity to attack for the round, etc.). The rules of how the cards are placed also depends on the terrain type.

Your decision of how you make your kingdom depends on trying to score certain elements while also using less valuable (point-wise) utility cards (cards that give you more cards, etc.).

—description from the publisher

Name: Word for Word
Description:
The game consists of a deck of 54 cards, each with a single letter and point value on it, as well as several 'Free' cards that can be used as any letter.  The entire deck is dealt out to all players face down.  Players may not look at their deck, but on their turn, flip over the top card and add it to the center of the table.  If they can make a word from the cards in the middle, they take it and score the points on those letters.  Play continues until all cards are used, and the player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

Name: Attack All Humans!
Description:
Inspired by the 1950's sci-fi movie genre, players take on the role of one of 4 alien races, to dish out vengeance on their captors, the humans. Be it through conquest, abduction, or plain 'ole vaporizing! All of these can garner you Points, but you'll have to move fast as the humans are developing The Doomsday Device, or might drop you the A-Bomb!

On your turn you'll use cards to move, mitigate action dice, and plan your action that round. Will you conquer a location to use its benefits? (Area Control), Abduct humans for the end game points(Set Collection), or plain ole' vaporize them for points? Don't forget your initial mission on Earth as these secret Objectives can put you over the edge and win! The game ends when either all players have orbited, or the humans devellop the Doomsday Device or dropped the A-Bomb! Do you want to risk getting extra points, or will this be the round the humans will capture you once again?(Press Your Luck).

—description from the designer

Name: Omen Peak
Description:
A co-op survival dice game where the players take on the role of Ancestor spirits, who are guiding their living Descendants to the summit of a mountain.  The tribe is making this pilgrimage to remember the Ancestors - and if the Descendants fail in their journey, the Ancestors will be forgotten for all eternity!  The Ancestors must work together to help the tribe survive.  The players win the game together if they manage to bring at least two Descendants to the mountaintop alive.  Any fewer than that, and the players all lose.

The game is played in rounds (5 to 20 max) which represent "days" of travel.  (Increasing duration increases game difficulty.) Each morning, the Shaman of the tribe rolls dice to interpret an Omen: resources that day will be Safe (neutral), Blessed (collect +1), or Cursed.  Taking cursed items will result in additional Danger for the Descendant who disobeyed the Omen!

Randomized terrain cards provide opportunities to forage for various resources - food, medicine, firewood, and crystals for banishing hostile evil spirits.  The Ancestors decide how best to match Descendants' skills to the resources available in any given location.  The more lucrative places also contain the greatest likelihood for danger! A player rolls once for each Descendant who forages during the day.

Each player's role gives them a special power to intervene on behalf of the Descendants.  Some banish evil spirits, heal Descendants, ward off sickness, or other helpful skills.

—description from the designer

Name: CoAUTHORation
Description:
A co-op storytelling card game where the players work together to guide the main character of a fantasy story to a suitable ending before any player runs out of cards.

Cards come in three suits: Characters, Places and Things.  One of each card type is used to create the main character, the hero/ine of the story.  A main character will also have a Trait and a Theme that help direct the narrative.

The players take turns as the Author to add cards from their hand to the table.  Everyone who is waiting for a turn is an Editor.  Editors offer suggestions (in the form of cards from their own hands), and reward the Author for creative plays with "Awesome cards" - as in "That was awesome!" - which are bonus cards added to the Author's stock.

Any card may introduce the namesake element into the story (eg. a volcano, Zombie, or mask), OR be used as an action to describe another character doing something (eg. incinerating, chasing, or tricking).  The cards provide a growing pool of words to be used, reused and reinterpreted as the story goes on.  The rules of narration may be as strict or generous as the players wish.  Spontaneous role-playing and voice-acting are often observed in casual play.

The game ends when the main character's conflict is resolved, or any player runs out of cards.  Players can resolve "cliff-hanger" endings in a number of ways: they may reveal the remaining cards, ad-lib a fitting resolution, or by player elimination.

CoAUTHORation can also be used for brainstorming or as a tool to overcome writer's block.

—description from the designer

Name: Kar-kas-onn
Description:
This is a fan-version of Carcassonne based in space. It replaces cities with habitats, roads with wormholes, and monastries with planets. The River becomes a Nebula and defines two different types of habitats.
It uses double-sided tiles that have to be drawn from a bag. This makes possible the introduction of tiles that trigger special actions.

—description from the designer

Name: Yahtzee: Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean
Description:
This game combines Yahtzee and Battle Yahtzee under the movie theme of Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean.  In Battle Yahtzee version, each player starts as one of the captain from the franchise. They receive a card that illustrates the captain and provides a special power (each captain has a different one) to be used during the game.

From the publisher's website: 
Play the classic shake, score & shout dice game or battle it out on the seven seas in this special edition of The Pirates of the Caribbean Yahtzee. Custom playing pieces including dice, game board and ship tokens add a unique twist full of pirate adventure as you roll high scoring dice combinations on the high seas!

Name: Robots & Rockets: Lightspeed
Description:
Welcome to the Lightspeed Space Station! As a skilled builder, help the station mark rockets capable of reaching the speed of light. Compete with others, earn the respect of Master Builders and become the best builder in the galaxy!

Robots & Rockets: Lightspeed is a competitive rocket-building card game for 2 to 4 players. The goal is to build and launch rockets to collect the greatest number of rocket parts by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alaska Inn
Description:
The rumor that the Yeti comes around at the Alaska is spreading out. A lot of Hunters hear it and gather for hunting the Yeti at the INN in front of the Snow Mountain.

Right here is the Alaska INN! Players become the hunter and hunt the Yeti for honor. Of course, some of them have no interest in hunting the Yeti and others seek to make benefit through the other ways! Sell the items to hunters, or research about the trace of the Yeti. 
Anyway, this is most interesting case of various cases in West Land recently.

Players stay the Alaska INN during the winter season and expect to see the Yeti. Players place their hunters every rounds for performing the action they want. The capable Actions of players are following: Paying the cost to employ a hunter, Manufacturing the items using their own materials, Selling the own items, Scoring the points by providing the trace and by funding to INN, Going out for hunting (to catch the Yeti or material or the trace and others).

At every round, Environment Card must be open. The Environment Card gives issue to players regarding the trace, change of weather and etc. This game will end when the winter season is over or the Yeti is caught. At this time, a player scoring the highest point will be a winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alliance: The Card Game
Description:
Alliance: The Card Game is a fantasy, dueling card game with warring factions, fighting to become the new and true Alliance. Players can enjoy this simple-to-learn, two-player, battle game between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle. The game of chance, simplified strategy, and fantasy warfare!

Zaldar's return from the dead, with a dragon army behind him, has shaken the world and now armies and factions of all kinds rally for war! The world needs a new Alliance, but who will form this new Alliance? Will Zaldar reign supreme? Or will it be...you?

Objective of Game: Battle between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle.

Components of Game: 35 Cards per deck, 6 sided die, Health Point Tokens, Game Board, Scroll of Rules, & stickers

How To Play: 
Leader Appears - place your Leader closest to you. The Leader will not be able to battle until the army in front of the Leader is defeated. 
Shuffle - shuffle your deck and place your deck face down to your right.
Army Line Up - draw the top 5 cards from your deck and place them face up in front of your Leader. This is your army, ready for battle.
Roll Order - both players roll the die. Whoever rolls the highest number goes first. Each turn consists of a Placement Phase and a Battle Phase. 
Placement Phase - if you have an army space open place the next top card from your deck in its place.
Battle Phase - you may attack twice per turn, but not with the same character. First declare who you're attacking by whom you're attacking with. Roll the die. If the number matches your character's Roll Number, you deal the character's corresponding Attack Number to your opponent's character's Health Points. If not, the attack misses and no damage is dealt. If damage is dealt more than your opponent's character's Health Points, then the character is slain and placed in the Slain Pile. If damage is dealt less than your opponent's character's Health Points, then Health Points are replaced with the correctly numbered Health Point Token. 
Leader's Entrance  - Your Leader comes into play when your army is depleted and no Units or Generals stand in front of him. The Leader can now attack, dealing the most damage on the battlefield, but can also be attacked by your opponent. 
Victory  -  Once your Leader's Health Points reach 0 you lose the battle. If your opponent's Leader's Health Points reach 0 you win the battle

Classes: 
Unit - bulk of army, 30 per deck, average attack and health points, & adorned with copper frame and tablet
General - more powerful characters on the battlefield, 4 per deck, stronger attack and health points, & adorned with silver frame and tablet
Leader - Leader of your army/Alliance, 1 per deck, strongest attack and health points & adorned with golden frame and tablet

Battling: Roll Numbers & Attack Numbers
When battling roll the die. If your roll matches your character's Roll Number then you deal the corresponding Attack Number (below the Roll Number). If the Attack Number is higher than your opponent's character's Health Points, then it's Slain and sent to the Slain Pile. If the Attack Number is lower than your opponent's character's Health Points, than replace their Health Points with the correctly numbered Health Point Token.

Character Types: 
Warrior
Beast 
Mage 
Beast Warrior
Beast Mage

Health Point Tokens:
